Copyright Issues Faced by Startups and Brands on Shark Tank India Season 3: Is It Worth Applying for Season 4?

brandemicindia

•

19/11/2024

SHARE

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Copyright Issues and Legal Notices Faced by Startups on Shark Tank India
  • Increased Exposure Leading to IP Disputes
  • Copycat Product Allegations and Trademark Conflicts
  • Lack of IP Awareness and Legal Vulnerabilities
  • The Cost of Legal Notices and Copyright Disputes
  • Using Shark Tank Clips for Marketing: Copyright Issues and Legal Limitations
  • Common Copyright Controversies with Shark Tank Clips
  • Licensing Shark Tank Clips as a Solution
  • Is It Worth Applying for Shark Tank India Season 4?
  • Advantages of Applying for Shark Tank India Season 4
  • Conclusion

Appearing on Shark Tank India can be a game-changer for startups, offering nationwide exposure, potential investment, and a boost in brand credibility. But while the spotlight has brought major rewards to many brands, it has also introduced legal hurdles that some were not prepared for—specifically copyright controversies related to intellectual property (IP) and the use of show footage in marketing. In Shark Tank India Season 3, these copyright issues and legal notice challenges raised questions for startups: Is the opportunity worth it, or do the risks outweigh the benefits?

This article explores the copyright issues and legal complexities that some startups faced in Shark Tank India Season 3 and examines if applying for Season 4 is a worthwhile move.

Related: The Best Pitches From Shark Tank India Season 2 And A Glimpse Into Season 3

Copyright Issues and Legal Notices Faced by Startups on Shark Tank India

For many entrepreneurs, a Shark Tank India pitch can become the most valuable piece of marketing content they’ll ever produce. However, copyright challenges have emerged, largely due to the increased visibility that makes startups vulnerable to IP scrutiny and restrictions on the use of Shark Tank clips in marketing. Here’s a closer look at the main copyright issues encountered by startups.

Increased Exposure Leading to IP Disputes

Appearing on Shark Tank India provides invaluable exposure, but it also attracts intense public and competitor scrutiny. Several Season 3 brands were hit with copyright infringement claims after their products and brand names gained national visibility. Competitors often alleged that certain product designs or trademarks overlapped with their own, sparking copyright controversies and leading some startups to receive formal legal notices shortly after their pitches aired.

Copycat Product Allegations and Trademark Conflicts

Indian startups often operate in highly competitive markets, especially in categories like tech, health, and beauty, where product uniqueness and patents are crucial. On Shark Tank India, some startups experienced copyright issues when competing companies claimed that their products or brand names were too similar to existing trademarks. This led to immediate copyright controversies and forced some brands to defend their IP publicly.

Lack of IP Awareness and Legal Vulnerabilities

Many early-stage startups, focused more on product development than legalities, may not fully understand the complexities of copyright, trademarks, and IP protection. Some brands on Season 3 faced legal notice threats because they hadn’t secured copyright or trademark protections prior to their appearance on the show. This left them vulnerable to legal disputes that could have been avoided with proactive IP protection measures.

The Cost of Legal Notices and Copyright Disputes

Receiving a legal notice or facing a copyright lawsuit can lead to substantial, unplanned legal expenses, which divert resources away from growth initiatives. Startups often find themselves needing to defend their IP claims in court, potentially spending thousands on legal fees, damaging their reputation, and sacrificing time and resources that could otherwise be spent on scaling their businesses.

Using Shark Tank Clips for Marketing: Copyright Issues and Legal Limitations

While pitching on Shark Tank India is an effective way to reach a large audience, the actual footage from the show belongs to the production company. In legal terms, this means that entrepreneurs who post or use their pitch clips for promotional purposes without permission may be infringing on the show’s copyright. The Season 3 startups that did so faced potential copyright controversies and, in some cases, received takedown notices from social media platforms.

Common Copyright Controversies with Shark Tank Clips

Content Takedowns:

Some startups experienced blocked or removed posts after sharing Shark Tank clips on platforms like Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn. When the production company flagged these posts, the platforms complied by taking down the content.

Legal Notices and Warnings:

Other brands received cease-and-desist orders after sharing their pitch videos in marketing. They were advised to either stop using the clips or face potential legal penalties for copyright infringement.

Missed Marketing Opportunities:

Losing access to Shark Tank pitch clips also means missing out on a powerful marketing tool. Many brands had to halt digital campaigns or social media promotions, limiting their ability to fully leverage the visibility gained from the show.

Licensing Shark Tank Clips as a Solution

For startups that wish to use their Shark Tank pitch clips without legal risk, obtaining a licensing agreement from the production company is a potential solution. Licensing agreements, while potentially costly, allow businesses to use their clips legally and avoid copyright issues while continuing to leverage their pitch for marketing purposes. This can be an effective strategy, especially for startups looking to incorporate the clips extensively in social media or advertising campaigns.

Is It Worth Applying for Shark Tank India Season 4?

For aspiring entrepreneurs, the benefits of Shark Tank India are undeniable, despite the copyright issues that have surfaced. Here’s an overview of the advantages and potential risks of applying for Season 4:

Advantages of Applying for Shark Tank India Season 4

Exposure and Reach:

The show offers unparalleled national exposure. With millions of viewers, brands reach a broad audience that would otherwise be hard to access.

Potential for Investment and Mentorship:

The sharks bring extensive experience and networks that can provide both funding and invaluable business insights. 

Enhanced Credibility:

Just being featured on Shark Tank India boosts brand credibility, enhancing trust among customers, investors, and partners.

Consumer Feedback:

Startups benefit from real-time feedback on their product or service, helping them understand market fit and improve their offerings.

Risks to Consider Before Applying

Copyright and Legal Complexities:

As Season 3 revealed, businesses need to be prepared for potential copyright issues and the legal costs associated with defending their IP.

Public Exposure to Criticism:

 With high visibility comes high risk. Brands that don’t make a favorable impression could face negative feedback from both sharks and viewers.

Operational Strain:

A successful pitch can lead to an influx of orders, which may strain an early-stage business’s capacity, making fulfillment challenging.

Steps for Startups to Safeguard Their IP Before Applying

If a startup is considering applying for Shark Tank India Season 4, they should take proactive steps to protect their intellectual property and avoid potential copyright issues.

Register Trademarks and Copyrights:

Securing all intellectual property, including brand names, logos, product designs, and patents, reduces the risk of post-show copyright disputes.

Conduct an IP Audit:

An IP audit can help a startup identify any potential gaps in its IP portfolio, providing a roadmap for legal protections.

Seek Legal Counsel:

Consulting an IP lawyer before appearing on Shark Tank can help entrepreneurs navigate copyright and trademark laws, ensuring they are fully protected.

Secure Clip Licensing Agreements:

If a brand wants to use their Shark Tank clips for promotional purposes, securing a licensing agreement will ensure they can do so legally and without copyright infringement risks.

Conclusion: Is It Worth the Copyright Risks to Apply for Season 4?

Shark Tank India Season 4 remains a valuable opportunity for startups, despite the copyright issues and legal complexities faced by brands in Season 3. For startups ready to take proactive measures to protect their intellectual property, the show can still provide unmatched exposure, credibility, and growth potential. But startups should be well-prepared: by securing copyrights, understanding the legal implications of content usage, and potentially licensing their pitch clips, entrepreneurs can fully leverage the benefits of Shark Tank India while minimizing the risk of copyright controversies.

FAQs

Can startups use Shark Tank clips on social media without permission?

The production company owns the footage, and using clips without permission can lead to copyright issues.

Why are Shark Tank clips removed from social media?

Social platforms comply with copyright laws and will take down any content flagged as copyrighted by the original creator, in this case, the production company.

Is licensing Shark Tank clips expensive?

The cost varies depending on the production company’s terms, but it can be a worthwhile investment for brands looking to make the most of their exposure on the show.

Can copyright issues affect a startup’s business growth?

Yes, legal costs and restrictions on content usage can slow growth, impacting brand visibility and customer acquisition efforts.

How can startups protect themselves before applying to Shark Tank India?

Securing trademarks, conducting IP audits, and consulting with IP attorneys are all essential steps for startups aiming to protect their intellectual property and reduce legal risks.

My Journey of Finding My Creative Voice at Brandemic: Lessons, Growth, and Breaking Design Rules

brandemicindia

•

12/11/2024

•

SHARE

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Finding My Creative Voice in the Design Industry
  • The Realities of Freelancing as a Designer
  • Lessons They Don’t Teach in Design School
  • The Reality Behind Freelancing
  • Breaking Design Rules: Finding My Unique Style
  • Building Meaningful Client Relationships
  • Advice for Designers Seeking Their Creative Voice

  • FAQs

Finding My Creative Voice in the Design Industry

When I first entered the design industry, I felt like an outsider in a world of complex rules, color theories, and unspoken guidelines. Many of my peers seemed to know exactly what they were doing, while I struggled to find my footing. My vision clashed with the structured design “rules” that dominated the industry. Despite my passion for creativity, I found myself questioning if I could really find my own creative voice within such a rigid framework.

The Realities of Freelancing as a Designer

Freelancing in design often appears glamorous on social media, where it’s portrayed as a path to freedom, independence, and creativity. The truth, however, is a little different. Freelancing meant juggling multiple projects, meeting tight deadlines, and managing diverse client expectations—all while trying to build my own unique style.

The hustle was real: constant client meetings, late nights, and the relentless drive to make a living. Far from the romanticized view of working in cozy cafes, freelancing pushed me to my limits. Yet, it was this hustle that taught me resilience and paved the way for me to create designs that truly resonated with brands. I evolved from simply delivering projects to crafting meaningful designs that aligned with each brand’s unique identity.

Lessons They Don’t Teach in Design School

Design school gave me a strong foundation in colour theory, grid systems, and typography, but it didn’t prepare me for real-world challenges like managing client feedback, navigating shifting expectations, and staying inspired. I learned quickly that working with clients is unpredictable; feedback often required me to revise my vision entirely.

Every project required adaptation, as each brand I worked with had its own distinct personality and voice. Balancing these different styles and expectations was both challenging and rewarding, giving me a breadth of experience that design school couldn’t offer. I came to realise that creating impactful designs went beyond technique it required empathy, adaptability, and a deep understanding of each brand’s goals.

The Reality Behind Freelancing

Freelancing can feel like a continuous balancing act—especially as a new designer. I spent countless hours refining my craft, testing new design techniques, and striving to deliver work that both satisfied clients and felt true to my vision. Managing multiple clients at once taught me how to stay organised, respond to feedback constructively, and prioritise my own creative growth amidst the demands of freelancing.

Through this process, I learned a critical lesson: design isn’t just about aesthetics. It’s about creating designs that resonate, evoke emotions, and serve a purpose. Freelancing pushed me to develop a style that clients would recognize and return for, fostering long-term partnerships instead of one-off projects.

Breaking Design Rules: Finding My Unique Style

Early in my career, I thought success in design meant following every industry rule and sticking closely to traditional design principles. I tried to fit each design into a structured grid, carefully adhere to colour theory, and abide by conventional composition techniques. But the more I adhered to these rules, the more restricted I felt, as though I were losing the very essence of what inspired me to design in the first place.

The turning point came when I allowed myself to experiment and break some of those “rules.” I began exploring new colours, unstructured compositions, and trusting my instincts. This shift helped me discover my authentic style—a voice in design that felt truly mine. I realised that the best designs often come from pushing boundaries and allowing creativity to flow without constraint.

Building Meaningful Client Relationships

As I leaned into my personal style, I noticed a significant change in my work dynamics. Projects became more than isolated tasks—they transformed into long-term collaborations. Clients appreciated my unique perspective, seeing me not just as a designer for hire, but as a trusted creative partner who could add value to their brand. My goal became to create designs that went beyond visual appeal, aiming to communicate a brand’s message in a way that would leave a lasting impression.

Today, I work with brands from diverse industries—from tech to FMCG to create designs that tell a story, communicate values, and foster connections. My mission is to produce visuals that not only look good but also resonate with people on a deeper level, making a real impact.

Advice for Designers Seeking Their Creative Voice

If I could offer one piece of advice to fellow designers, it would be this: design isn’t just about following the rules. The fundamentals are essential, but true growth comes from experimentation and trusting your instincts. Success isn’t about rigidly adhering to principles; it’s about creating work that reflects who you are.

So, don’t be afraid to break boundaries and carve your own path. Design is about adapting, understanding your own voice, and building something meaningful. Every late night, challenging project, and client critique brings you closer to your creative voice. Embrace the journey, and remember that each step brings you closer to finding the unique style that’s truly yours.

Final Reflections

Reflecting on my journey, I see how every challenge, late night, and moment of doubt has brought me to where I am today—a place where I can confidently say I’ve found my creative voice. From initially struggling with the “rules” of design to embracing my own unique style, I’ve learned that the journey is as important as the destination.

I’m not just here to create beautiful visuals; I’m here to craft designs that tell stories, communicate values, and make a lasting impact. To every designer out there: remember, the hustle is real, but so is the reward. Embrace the journey, break a few rules, and most importantly, never stop searching for your creative voice.

FAQs

How do you manage creative blocks as a designer?

Creative blocks are inevitable, especially when working across diverse industries. When I feel stuck, I take a break, seek inspiration from unrelated sources, or try experimenting without pressure. This often leads to unexpected breakthroughs.

What helped you transition from freelancing to long-term brand partnerships?

The transition came from focusing on creating designs with meaning. Clients began to see the depth in my work, which opened up more collaborative opportunities. Consistently understanding and addressing each brand’s unique needs helped clients view me as a creative partner rather than just a designer.

Do you believe design “rules” are meant to be broken?

Absolutely. Rules are essential for learning, but some of the most impactful designs come from breaking those rules and trusting your instincts. It’s about balancing fundamentals with creativity to create something uniquely yours.

What lesson has shaped your approach to design the most?

The biggest lesson I’ve learned is that design is about resonance, not just aesthetics. This mindset has guided me to create designs that connect on an emotional level, not just visually.

What advice would you give to designers who feel like outsiders in the industry?

Don’t be discouraged! I felt like an outsider, too. Focus on what excites you and stay true to your authentic style. Design is a diverse field with space for individuality. Trust the process, stay curious, and bring your unique perspective to the table.

Make The Move

The Power of User-Generated Video Content

brandemicindia

•

06/11/2024

•

11 min read

SHARE

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • What is User-Generated Content?
  • Why Should You Be Using UGC Ads In Your Campaigns?
  • How to Find the Right UGC Actors & Creators for Your Brand
  • Best Practices for Shooting High-ROI User-Generated Video Content
  • UGC Video Filming: Bringing Your Brand Story to Life
  • Conclusion

The rise of User-generated content (UGC) has made it a powerful tool for brands seeking to connect with their audiences in a more genuine and interesting way. At the forefront of this trend is user-generated video content, which offers a dynamic platform for consumers to share their experiences, opinions, and creativity. From social media platforms to advertising campaigns, UGC videos are changing how marketing works, giving brands a great chance to use their audience’s creativity. In this blog, we’ll talk about what user-generated content is, why it’s important for your campaigns, and how to make UGC video content that gets good results.

What is User-Generated Content?

User-generated content is what happens when everyday people create and post things like videos, photos, reviews, or opinions, rather than fancy companies or professionals. 

It’s like online word-of-mouth, where folks share their thoughts and experiences with products or services with friends or online groups. UGC is real, trusted, and easy to relate to, which makes it super helpful for brands trying to connect with their audience in a meaningful way.

Why Should You Be Using UGC Ads In Your Campaigns?

A lot of people are getting sick and tired of ads and don’t trust them as much as before. So, brands are looking for new ways to connect with customers. UGC ads are one solution because they use content created by regular people, which is seen as more believable and real. Studies have found that people trust recommendations from friends more than ads from companies. This makes UGC ads great for building loyalty and encouraging people to buy. By using UGC videos in your ads, you can benefit from this trust and reach more people with your brand message.

How to Find the Right UGC Actors & Creators for Your Brand

Finding the perfect User Generated Content (UGC) actors and creators for your brand means going through some steps to make sure they match your brand’s values, the people you want to reach, and what you want to achieve with your marketing. Here’s a list of pointers to help you find the right UGC partners:

  1. Define Your Brand Identity and Goals:
  • Establish clear brand values, tone, and messaging.
  • Outline specific marketing objectives and how UGC fits into your strategy.
  1. Understand Your Audience:
  • Identify your target demographic, including their interests and online behavior.
  • Determine where your audience engages with content online.
  1. Research Potential Collaborators:
  • Explore relevant social media platforms, content-sharing sites, and influencer networks.
  • Look for creators whose content style and audience resonate with your brand.
  1. Assess Content Quality and Engagement:
  • Evaluate the quality of potential collaborators’ content.
  • Analyze their engagement metrics such as likes, comments, and follower growth.
  1. Ensure Brand Alignment:
  • Confirm that potential collaborators’ values and image align with your brand.
  • Investigate their previous partnerships and reputation.
  1. Initiate Contact:
  • Reach out to potential collaborators via social media, email, or influencer platforms.
  • Express interest in collaboration and outline mutual benefits.
  1. Negotiate Terms:
  • Discuss compensation, content usage rights, and any contractual agreements.
  • Set clear expectations and timelines to avoid misunderstandings.
  1. Provide Guidance:
  • Offer detailed guidelines for content creation and brand messaging.
  • Provide necessary support and feedback throughout the collaboration.
  1. Encourage Authenticity:
  • Allow collaborators creative freedom within brand guidelines.
  • Foster authentic storytelling and genuine engagement with your brand.
  1. Track Performance:
  • Monitor the performance of UGC campaigns using relevant metrics.
  • Analyze feedback and adjust future brand collaborations accordingly.
  1. Cultivate Relationships:
  • Build long-term relationships with successful collaborators.
  • Show appreciation for their contributions and loyalty to your brand.

Best Practices for Shooting High-ROI User-Generated Video Content

Shooting user-generated videos that give you a good return on investment (ROI) can be a smart move for brands. It’s a great way to connect with your audience in a genuine and budget-friendly manner. Follow these tips to help you out:

Know Your Audience

Understand who you’re making the videos for. Think about their age, what they like, and what they care about. This helps you create videos they’ll enjoy and want to share.

Set Goals

Decide what you want to achieve with your videos. Do you want more people to know about your brand? Or do you want to sell more products? Having clear goals helps you make videos that work.

Give Clear Instructions

Tell people what you want them to do in the videos. Explain what kind of videos you’re looking for, how long they should be, and any other important details. This helps people make the right kind of videos for you.

Make It Easy

Give people tools and tips to make good videos. Show them how to use their phones or cameras, and maybe give them templates or examples to follow. The easier it is, the more likely they’ll join in.

Reward Participation

Give people something in return for making videos. It could be a discount on your products, a shoutout on social media, or even a chance to win something cool. This makes people excited to get involved.

Be Real

Encourage people to be themselves in the videos. Authentic videos that show real experiences are more interesting and relatable. People will trust your brand more if they see real people enjoying it.

Keep It Consistent

Make sure the videos match your brand’s style and values. Even though they’re made by different people, they should all feel like they come from the same place. This makes your brand stronger and more recognizable.

Say Thanks

Show appreciation for people who make videos. Respond to their videos, share them on your social media, or even feature them in your ads. This makes people feel good and encourages others to join in too.

Check How It's Going

Keep an eye on how your videos are doing. Look at things like how many people are watching them, sharing them, or buying your products because of them. This helps you know if your videos are working or if you need to change something.

Follow the Rules

Make sure you’re allowed to use the videos people send you. Get permission from the people in the videos, and make sure you’re not using music or other stuff that you’re not allowed to. This keeps you out of trouble.

UGC Video Filming: Bringing Your Brand Story to Life

User-made videos can do more than just pop up on social media. They’re like a Swiss Army knife for marketing – useful in lots of different ways. Here’s how you can use these videos on different platforms and plans to make your brand stand out and talk to your audience in a way that really grabs their attention:

Be Real

The most important thing about UGC video production is being real. Encourage people to share their true experiences with your stuff on camera. Genuine feelings and reactions are what you’re after, not something that seems too planned or fake. When videos feel genuine, they build trust with viewers and make them more likely to watch and share.

Show Everyone

When picking people for your videos, try to include all kinds of different people. Show different ages, backgrounds, and experiences. This makes your videos more relatable to everyone who watches them. It’s important for everyone to feel like they’re represented.

Keep it Short and Interesting

 People today don’t have long attention spans, so keep your videos short and interesting. Grab people’s attention right away and keep it interesting the whole time. Tell your story quickly and clearly without adding anything unnecessary. Use cool visuals, music, and editing tricks to make your videos fun to watch.

Use Social Media and Review Sites

Put your videos where lots of people can see them by using social media and review sites. Ask people to share their videos on their own social media pages too. This helps your videos reach more people. You can also team up with popular places where people share videos online to get even more views.

See How It's Doing

Once your videos are out there, keep an eye on how they’re doing. Look at how many views, likes, shares, and comments they’re getting. This tells you if people are interested in your videos. Listen to what people are saying about your videos so you can make them even better next time.

Conclusion

User-made videos are like gold in online marketing. They’re real, and people love that. These videos let brands talk to their audience in a way that feels genuine and friendly. Using user-made videos on social media, emails, and websites helps brands share their story in a fun and relatable way. Plus, teaming up with popular people online, like influencers, can spread the word even more.

To really make the most of these videos, it’s important to keep things simple and pay attention to how they’re doing. By sticking to easy tips for making these videos and watching how many people are watching, liking, and sharing them, brands can make sure they’re on the right track.

Embracing user-made videos isn’t just about marketing—it’s about building a stronger connection with your audience. When people see real folks enjoying your brand, they’re more likely to trust and support it. So, dive into user-made videos and see how they can help your brand shine online.

DJ by Night, Marketing Wizard by Day: My Double Life in Two Worlds

brandemicindia

•

29/10/2024

•

SHARE

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • The Start of Two Passions: SEO Meets DJ Life
  • Building DotMe: A Creator’s Dream
  • Switching Between SEO and DJ: How I Make It Work
  • Creative Crossover: How DJing Makes Me a Better SEO Pro
  • Staying Relevant: Continuously Evolving in Both Worlds
  • Mental Reset: Why DJing Completes My Day
  • Organisation Is Key: Staying on Top of Two Careers
  • Making an Impact: SEO and DJing Are Both About Connection
  • Long Game: Mastering SEO and DJing
  • Passion: The Drive Behind the Hustle
  • In conversation with MusicMonk

When people find out I live a double life, they usually ask, “How do you balance it all?” By day, I’m a hardcore SEO strategist and business developer at Brandemic, and by night, I’m spinning tracks as a DJ at top nightclubs in Bangalore. It’s a mix of digital savvy and high-energy beats, algorithms by day, and vibes by night. These worlds might seem poles apart, but they actually fuel each other, giving me a unique edge in both fields. Here’s how I do it, why I love it, and why I wouldn’t trade it for anything.

The Start of Two Passions: SEO Meets DJ Life

I didn’t exactly plan on juggling SEO and DJing as careers; both just sort of evolved from my passions. My SEO journey started with Brandemic, where I spend my days optimising websites, handling business development calls, and managing DotMe, a community of creators that I’m genuinely passionate about. The SEO side of things keeps my mind sharp, my skills fresh, and has me constantly finding ways to bring traffic and visibility to brands.On the flip side, my DJ journey has been an entirely different kind of hustle. I’ve always had a thing for music, but I took it seriously only in 2017. The first couple of years were tough; I was unknown, grinding through unpaid gigs just to get a spot behind the decks. There were nights where I played to near-empty rooms or crowds that didn’t know my name, but I kept at it. Today, I’m the head resident DJ at one of South Bangalore’s top nightclubs and freelance across the city. It’s been a wild ride, and honestly, I wouldn’t have it any other way.

Building DotMe: A Creator’s Dream

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by DotMe (@dotme.in)

Aside from SEO and DJing, managing DotMe has been one of my favourite parts of the journey. DotMe is a community that brings together creators from all backgrounds, and because I’m an artist myself, building this space felt natural. I understand the creative grind, the hustle to stand out, and the need for the right tools and support. Working on DotMe doesn’t feel like work; it’s where I can help people like me reach their full potential. It’s my way of giving back to the creative community while staying engaged with what I love. This balance, of growing businesses during the day and building a creator community after hours, keeps me grounded, inspired, and fully charged to take on both worlds.

Switching Between SEO and DJ: How I Make It Work

Balancing these two intense jobs means I’m constantly switching mindsets. In SEO, it’s all about structure, analysis, and precision. I’m diving into algorithms, keyword research, and strategies to push websites to the top. But come nighttime, I switch gears entirely. When I’m DJing, it’s about letting go, feeling the music, and syncing with the crowd. There’s no structure to it—just instinct, creativity, and adrenaline.

The key to making it work? Balance. SEO is intense, requiring a clear mind and the ability to focus on the details. DJing, though, is pure energy and vibes. The balance between these two is what keeps me motivated. I start my mornings with SEO and business development calls, and by evening, I’m setting up my playlists, ready to dive into the beats.

Creative Crossover: How DJing Makes Me a Better SEO Pro

Here’s the thing most people don’t realise, SEO and DJing have a lot in common. Both require you to understand your audience. As an SEO pro, I’m constantly optimising for user experience, figuring out what users want and how to reach them. As a DJ, I’m doing the same thing—reading the room, feeling the crowd’s energy, and delivering what they’re craving.

DJing has taught me to think on my feet, which has made me way more flexible and creative with SEO. The improvisation I bring to my sets helps me approach SEO challenges from different angles. Whether it’s changing up an SEO strategy or adjusting a DJ set, creativity and flexibility are what keep both careers fresh and exciting.

Staying Relevant: Continuously Evolving in Both Worlds

SEO and DJing share another thing in common, they both evolve fast. In SEO, algorithms are always changing, and staying on top means keeping up with new trends and tools. I spend a lot of time reading up on the latest updates from Google, checking out new tools, and experimenting with strategies.

Similarly, in DJing, music trends are always changing. I constantly update my playlists, looking for the freshest tracks to keep the crowd on their toes. Just like SEO, you can’t rely on old hits forever. The only way to stay relevant is to keep evolving. This constant learning keeps things exciting, and it’s what makes the grind worthwhile.

Mental Reset: Why DJing Completes My Day

One of the best things about DJing is that it’s the perfect mental reset. After a day of SEO audits, keyword research, and business development calls, I can’t think of a better way to unwind than by stepping into the DJ booth. The music takes over, and I can let go of the structure and analysis that SEO requires. For a few hours, I’m just in the moment, feeling the energy of the crowd.

It’s a reminder that there’s more to life than algorithms and data. DJing gives me a creative outlet where I can be free, play around, and enjoy the vibe. It’s not just a side gig; it’s a break from the routine that recharges me for the next day.

Organisation Is Key: Staying on Top of Two Careers

Managing two demanding jobs is no joke, and staying organised is what keeps me going. From calendars to task managers, I rely on every tool available to juggle my SEO work with DJ gigs. If I didn’t have a solid system in place, burnout would be inevitable.

Each day is a mix of SEO strategies, client calls, business development, and DJ prep. It’s intense, but the satisfaction of seeing my SEO campaigns succeed and my DJ sets come to life makes it worth it. Organisation is everything, and having a structured routine lets me keep up with the craziness of both worlds.

Making an Impact: SEO and DJing Are Both About Connection

At the end of the day, both SEO and DJing are about impact. In SEO, I’m helping brands grow their online presence, connecting them with the people searching for their services. In DJing, I’m connecting with people on a different level, creating experiences they’ll remember.

Both roles are about delivering value, whether it’s getting results for a client’s brand or giving a crowd an unforgettable night. When I see a campaign perform well or a dance floor packed with people feeling the music, that’s the high that keeps me going.

Long Game: Mastering SEO and DJing

Neither of these careers happened overnight. Both require dedication, persistence, and a lot of learning. In SEO, a single mistake can affect a campaign, while in DJing, playing the wrong track can kill the vibe. Every challenge I’ve faced has made me better at what I do, and every success has fueled my passion for both fields.

Building a career in SEO and DJing is a marathon, not a sprint. Both require the patience to learn, experiment, fail, and then get back up. And that’s the journey I’m here for.

Passion: The Drive Behind the Hustle

People often ask me why I take on two demanding careers, and my answer is simple: I love both worlds. The passion for SEO and DJing drives me every day, even when it’s exhausting. It’s that passion that makes the late nights, the early mornings, and the back-to-back grind feel like a privilege, not a chore.

The excitement of nailing an SEO strategy or dropping the perfect beat on the dance floor, that’s what makes it all worth it. When you’re passionate, the work doesn’t feel like work; it’s just part of the journey.

In conversation with MusicMonk

How do you manage both SEO work and DJing?

It’s all about staying organised. Mornings are for SEO, nights are for DJing, and a structured routine keeps both worlds balanced.

What inspired you to take on both careers?

My love for creativity and problem-solving. SEO and DJing let me connect with people in different ways, and I’m passionate about both.

How does DJing help your SEO work?

DJing keeps my creativity sharp and helps me think outside the box when tackling SEO problems. Reading crowds translates to reading digital audiences.

What’s the best part about managing DotMe?

Building a creator community that inspires others. DotMe is my way of connecting with artists and helping them grow, which fuels my own creativity.

How do you stay updated in both fields?

Constant learning is key. I’m always reading about SEO trends and discovering new music. Both require staying relevant to succeed.

What’s next for your journey?

Growing my SEO expertise and expanding DotMe’s community, while continuing to spin beats and keep the dance floors alive. 

Make The Move

The post Grit Over Degree : My Journey from Design Intern to Award-Winning Developer appeared first on Brandemic.

Grit Over Degree : My Journey from Design Intern to Award-Winning Developer

brandemicindia

•

25/10/2024

•

11 min read

SHARE

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • The Beginning: Grit Over Degrees
  • Joining Brandemic: A Career-Defining Moment
  • The Importance of Diverse Skills
  • Award-Winning Work: The Result of Hard-Won Skills
  • Financial Independence: A Byproduct of Skill Diversification
  • Mentorship: The Next Phase of My Career
  • The Impact of a Non-Traditional Path

When I look back on the past four years, it’s hard to believe how far I’ve come—from starting as a design intern to leading the development of award-winning websites. I’ve always had a passion for design, but I decided early on that college wasn’t the path for me. Instead, I focused on acquiring diverse skills that would allow me to excel in real-world situations. Now, having designed and developed over 100 business and eCommerce websites, I can confidently say that skipping a degree was one of the best decisions I ever made. Here’s how I did it.

The Beginning: Grit Over Degrees

When I first started as a Social Media Executive at the age of 18, working for the Indian National Congress, I knew I had to differentiate myself. Without a formal education to lean on, I focused on learning by doing. I immersed myself in design software like Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and After Effects, mastering them on the go. My responsibilities, which included handling social media content for a major political party, gave me my first taste of the importance of versatility.

It wasn’t just about creating good designs; I quickly learned how crucial it was to understand audience behavior and content strategy. Designing visually compelling graphics that also delivered the right message helped me build a strong foundation in communication through design.

I knew early on that graphic design alone wouldn’t be enough. The digital landscape was evolving quickly, and I saw the growing demand for UI/UX design and web development. So, I set my sights on mastering these skills. I began learning WordPress, Webflow, and Shopify in my free time, and before long, I had enough expertise to start building websites from scratch.

Joining Brandemic: A Career-Defining Moment

In 2020, as the pandemic altered the job market, I took a pivotal step by joining Brandemic as a Social Media Manager. It wasn’t long before I transitioned into the role of Project Manager and Lead Developer. While social media strategy was my initial responsibility, my curiosity about web development was impossible to ignore. I threw myself into learning more about user-centered design and how web development works behind the scenes.

At Brandemic, I had the chance to work on a wide range of projects, designing websites for businesses across industries like healthcare, retail, and entertainment. One of my first major projects involved creating a user-friendly eCommerce website for Walkmate, a B2B footwear brand. What made the project unique wasn’t just the challenge of simplifying a complex product catalog but also ensuring that the user journey was seamless and intuitive. This was when I realized that the key to successful web development is a combination of aesthetics, functionality, and empathy for the user.

The most valuable part of my work at Brandemic was the diversity of the industries we catered to. From healthcare to retail and even entertainment, every sector had its own unique demands. Whether it was creating a seamless booking experience for East Point Hospitals or an interactive event platform for BookMyShow, each project pushed me to tailor my designs for specific business needs.

The Importance of Diverse Skills

One of the most critical lessons I’ve learned in my career is the power of diverse skills. By not limiting myself to just graphic design, I’ve been able to take on a variety of roles that go beyond what a traditional degree might have offered. At Brandemic, I’ve managed everything from UI/UX research to full-scale web development using tools like WordPress, Shopify, and Webflow. Each project presented its own set of challenges, but it also provided a unique learning opportunity.

For instance, designing an award-winning website for Mahindra involved balancing corporate branding with user engagement. We needed to ensure that the website’s design reflected Mahindra’s legacy while also offering modern, user-friendly navigation. This project taught me that branding and user experience are two sides of the same coin. Without one, the other falls flat.

In addition to this, I started diving deeper into SEO optimization and content strategy. These are often overlooked by designers but can make or break a website’s success. The more I worked on these aspects, the more I understood how critical they were in driving traffic and improving user engagement. This holistic approach—combining design, development, and content—set me apart from others in the field.

Being involved in both design and development has also meant that I can bridge the gap between these two worlds. I’m able to speak the language of developers while also ensuring that the design vision is preserved. This dual capability has not only allowed me to build better websites but also made me a more valuable asset to the teams I work with.

Award-Winning Work: The Result of Hard-Won Skills

One of the proudest achievements of my career has been winning the Big Bang Awards and the Foxglove Awards for web development projects. These awards were a direct result of my work on high-impact projects at Brandemic, where I led the design and development of over 100 websites for businesses of all sizes.

One project, in particular, that stands out was for Eximius Ventures, a leading venture capital firm. The challenge here was to build a site that not only showcased their portfolio but also provided a seamless user experience for potential investors and startups. The complexity of the project forced me to push my skills to new limits, especially in terms of SEO optimization, responsive design, and making sure the site was scalable for future updates.

Receiving these awards didn’t just validate my work; it reinforced that taking an unconventional route, choosing self-learning over formal education, was the right path for me. I had created something tangible, something that performed well in the real world, and that was more rewarding than any degree could have been.

Financial Independence: A Byproduct of Skill Diversification

One of the most surprising and rewarding aspects of my journey has been achieving financial independence through my work. By diversifying my skill set, I’ve been able to take on a variety of projects across industries, each offering unique financial opportunities. Whether it’s designing a healthcare website or consulting on eCommerce development, I’ve gained a reputation as someone who can deliver results.

Beyond the financial rewards, this independence has allowed me to offer consulting services to businesses looking for insights into website development, user experience, and digital strategy. I’ve had the chance to work with prominent clients like EOS Globe and East Point Hospitals, offering them a unique blend of design and technical expertise that’s hard to find in the market.

Being financially independent from such a young age also allowed me to reinvest in my growth. I’ve taken courses in advanced design, development, and even business consulting—all of which have made me more well-rounded as a professional. This reinvestment in myself has been crucial to staying competitive in a constantly evolving industry.

This financial independence didn’t happen overnight. It’s the result of years of hard work, long hours, and a relentless pursuit of learning. But it’s also proof that the decision to focus on real-world experience over a college degree has paid off in ways I never anticipated.

Mentorship: The Next Phase of My Career

As I continue to grow in my career, one of the most fulfilling aspects has been the opportunity to mentor new team members. Having started without formal education, I know how challenging it can be to break into the industry, especially without the traditional credentials that many people rely on. That’s why I make it a point to share my knowledge and experiences with others who are just starting out.

At Brandemic, I’ve helped train interns and junior designers on everything from UI/UX principles 

to web development best practices. One of the highlights of my mentorship journey was guiding a group of interns as they developed a website for BookMyShow, one of India’s largest entertainment platforms. Watching them grow from novices into confident designers and developers was incredibly rewarding. It’s moments like these that remind me why I started this journey in the first place—to learn, grow, and eventually help others do the same.

In mentoring, I’ve found a new passion: giving back. It’s not just about passing on technical skills but also instilling the mindset that learning doesn’t stop after a project is completed. By teaching others to embrace this continuous growth mindset, I feel like I’m shaping the next generation of creators and developers.

The Impact of a Non-Traditional Path

The decision to forgo a college degree and focus on acquiring practical, real-world skills has had a profound impact on my career. By working on a wide range of projects across various industries, I’ve been able to gain a deep understanding of how different sectors operate. This experience has made me financially independent much earlier than I expected, and it’s given me the confidence to offer consulting services and insights into almost every aspect of web development.

But more than that, this journey has allowed me to build a career that I’m genuinely passionate about. Whether it’s the satisfaction of seeing a website go live or the joy of mentoring someone new to the field, the rewards of this path have been immense.

Looking back, I can confidently say that the risk I took was worth it. Skipping a traditional degree allowed me to focus on what really mattered—learning skills that would set me apart in a competitive industry. And now, as I continue to grow, I’m excited to see what the future holds. 

After all, the best part about this journey is that I’m still learning, still growing, and still finding new ways to challenge myself.

Connect with me

FAQ

How did you learn web development without a degree?

I focused on self-learning through online resources like YouTube, Udemy, and free coding platforms. I also took on projects that pushed me outside my comfort zone, forcing me to learn new skills.

What was your biggest challenge when transitioning from graphic design to web development?

Understanding how design interacts with functionality was the hardest part. Graphic design is purely visual, but web development requires thinking about how users will navigate and interact with a website.

How do you stay motivated to keep learning new skills?

The satisfaction of seeing my designs come to life keeps me motivated. Also, staying up to date with the latest design and development trends ensures that my work stays relevant.

Why didn’t you pursue a traditional degree?

I felt that real-world experience would teach me more practical skills than a degree could. I wanted to get my hands dirty with actual projects and learn through doing.

What advice would you give to someone starting out in web design or development?

Focus on learning the basics, but don’t be afraid to take on bigger projects. The more you push yourself, the faster you’ll learn.

What’s the next step for your career?

I’m expanding my mentorship program to guide aspiring designers and developers. I’m also diving deep into emerging technologies like AR/VR and Web3 to stay at the forefront of digital innovation and deliver cutting-edge solutions to my clients.

If you’re searching for the best SEO company in Bangalore, you’re in luck. Bangalore is home to some of the most well-established and innovative SEO agencies in India. Whether you’re a small business looking to boost your online presence or a large corporation aiming for global reach, choosing the right SEO services in Bangalore can make all the difference.

With so many options available, it’s essential to find a reliable, results-driven SEO partner that understands your business goals. In this article, we’ll introduce some of the best SEO agencies in Bangalore, each with its unique offerings, expertise, and success stories. So, let’s dive in!

Brandemic

Starting with Brandemic, this agency has earned its reputation for delivering effective SEO services that drive traffic and boost rankings. Specialising in branding, web development, and UI/UX,  Brandemic tailors its SEO strategies to enhance brand visibility, making it a top choice for businesses looking to improve both online rankings and brand recognition. Their approach to SEO includes keyword optimization, on-page SEO, off-page link-building strategies, and more. If you’re seeking a creative, full-service SEO agency in Bangalore, Brandemic is definitely worth considering.

What makes Brandemic stand out is their focus on customizing SEO strategies for each client, ensuring that every campaign aligns with the business’s unique goals. Their team of SEO experts uses data-driven insights to craft strategies that improve search engine rankings while enhancing brand image. Whether you’re a startup or a well-established brand, Brandemic provides personalized SEO solutions to meet your needs.

BrandStory is not just about rankings—they aim to improve the overall user experience on your website, which naturally leads to better SEO performance. Their holistic approach to digital marketing ensures that SEO is integrated with other marketing channels like social media, content, and PPC, offering a full-service solution.

As one of the top SEO companies in Bangalore, BrandStory has worked with various industries, from e-commerce to B2B, and has helped numerous clients achieve their SEO goals. Whether you’re looking for local SEO or national-level campaigns, BrandStory’s tailored services are designed to meet your specific objectives.

Infidigit

What sets Infidigit apart from other agencies is its emphasis on performance-driven SEO. With a deep understanding of the latest Google algorithms, they keep up with changes in SEO trends, ensuring that your website stays optimized for the long term.

For companies looking for the best SEO services in Bangalore, Infidigit offers tailored solutions that focus on achieving sustainable growth. Their SEO packages are highly customizable, making them ideal for businesses across sectors, whether you’re in e-commerce, finance, or tech.

DigiMark Agency

DigiMark Agency is another notable SEO services company in Bangalore that offers a wide range of digital marketing solutions, with SEO being one of their core offerings. The agency specializes in both on-page and off-page SEO, providing strategies that improve search engine rankings, website performance, and overall digital visibility.

What’s impressive about DigiMark Agency is their results-driven approach. They emphasize thorough keyword research, competitor analysis, and content optimization to ensure your website is well-positioned in the SERPs. Their team of SEO experts also focuses on enhancing user experience, which is a critical factor in achieving long-term SEO success.

Whether you’re a small local business or a large corporation, DigiMark Agency offers scalable SEO solutions to suit your needs. Their flexibility, combined with a strong focus on ROI, makes them one of the best SEO agencies in Bangalore.

Percoyo

Looking for a full-suite search engine optimization company in Bangalore? Percoyo is a great choice. This agency takes a comprehensive approach to SEO, focusing on improving both organic rankings and website usability. They offer services like keyword analysis, technical SEO audits, and link-building strategies to help businesses drive more traffic.

Percoyo prides itself on being a customer-centric SEO agency, offering personalized solutions that are tailored to each client’s specific needs. Their team includes experienced SEO experts who are well-versed in the latest SEO trends and techniques. One unique aspect of Percoyo is its dedication to educating clients about the SEO process, ensuring that you understand the strategies being implemented and how they contribute to your long-term goals.

ThatWare

ThatWare is a leading SEO company in India, based in Bangalore, with a focus on AI-powered SEO strategies. They combine traditional SEO techniques with cutting-edge AI tools to offer advanced solutions that improve rankings, traffic, and conversions. ThatWare specializes in technical SEO, voice search optimization, and content marketing, making them a great choice for businesses looking for innovative solutions.

The agency’s unique approach to SEO allows them to analyze vast amounts of data and derive actionable insights that help improve site performance. Their AI-driven strategies are designed to adapt to the constantly changing digital landscape, giving your business a competitive edge.

If you’re looking for a forward-thinking SEO agency in Bangalore that leverages AI for search engine optimization, ThatWare is an excellent option.

RankFast

RankFast is another top contender when it comes to SEO services in Bangalore. Known for their expertise in link building and technical SEO, RankFast offers customized SEO packages that cater to businesses of all sizes. Their team focuses on delivering quick results without compromising on quality, making them a popular choice for businesses looking to improve their rankings swiftly.

One of the unique selling points of RankFast is their focus on local SEO. They help businesses optimize for local search results, ensuring that your business appears in Google Maps and other location-based searches. This is particularly beneficial for companies with physical locations looking to attract nearby customers.

For businesses in Bangalore, RankFast provides the best local SEO services, helping you rank higher in location-based searches and attract more foot traffic to your store or office.

Kloc Technologies is a full-service digital marketing agency with a strong focus on SEO services in Bangalore. They help businesses rank higher on search engines by implementing best practices tailored to meet the unique needs of each client.

What sets Kloc Technologies apart is their emphasis on transparency and regular reporting. They provide clients with detailed insights into their SEO campaigns, allowing you to track performance metrics and understand the impact of SEO on your business.

Whether you’re a startup looking to grow your online presence or an established company aiming to strengthen your digital marketing efforts, Kloc Technologies offers the tools and expertise you need.

With a team of experienced SEO experts, Growth Hackers Digital takes a data-driven approach to SEO. They emphasize A/B testing, performance optimization, and content marketing to ensure that your site is continuously improving. For businesses aiming to see significant growth in a short period, Growth Hackers Digital is one of the top SEO agencies in Bangalore to consider.

EZ Rankings

EZ Rankings is a globally recognized SEO company in India, with a strong presence in Bangalore. The agency provides a complete range of digital marketing services, with SEO being at the forefront of their offerings. They specialize in both local and global SEO, making them a great choice for businesses targeting diverse markets.

What makes EZ Rankings stand out is their client-first approach. They offer customized SEO solutions tailored to each client’s industry, target audience, and business goals. Their SEO experts focus on driving organic traffic, improving keyword rankings, and ensuring long-term growth.

For businesses looking for a versatile and experienced SEO agency in Bangalore, EZ Rankings offers competitive services that cater to a wide range of needs.

Conclusion

Finding the best SEO company in Bangalore is crucial for achieving online success. Whether you’re looking for comprehensive SEO services, local SEO expertise, or AI-powered solutions, Bangalore offers a diverse array of agencies ready to help your business grow.

From Brandemic to EZ Rankings, the options are abundant for those seeking expert SEO solutions tailored to their specific business goals. The key to choosing the right SEO partner is understanding your business needs and selecting an agency that aligns with your objectives. With the right SEO agency by your side, your business can achieve higher rankings, more traffic, and ultimately, greater success in the digital space.

FAQ

1. What is SEO, and why is it important for my business?

SEO (Search Engine Optimization) is the process of optimizing your website to improve its visibility on search engines like Google. Higher visibility increases traffic, leads, and sales, making SEO crucial for business growth, especially in a competitive market like Bangalore.

2. How do I choose the best SEO company in Bangalore?

Look for an SEO company that has experience in your industry, offers customized solutions, has a proven track record, and provides transparent reporting. Agencies like Brandemic, BrandStory, and Infidigit are highly reputable and offer a range of services tailored to different business needs.

3. What are the top SEO services offered by agencies in Bangalore?

The top services include on-page SEO, off-page SEO, keyword research, technical SEO, local SEO, content optimization, link building, and performance tracking. Leading agencies like DigiMark Agency, RankFast, and Percoyo offer comprehensive SEO solutions.

4. Why should I hire an SEO agency in Bangalore instead of doing it in-house?

SEO requires constant monitoring, updates, and technical expertise. Hiring a professional SEO agency ensures your strategy is up-to-date with the latest algorithms and best practices, saving you time and delivering better results through specialized skills.

5. How long does it take to see SEO results?

SEO is a long-term strategy. Depending on the competitiveness of your industry and the quality of the SEO services, you can expect to see noticeable improvements in search rankings and traffic within 3 to 6 months.
